conclusion: The horizontal conveyor belt is moving clockwise at a speed of v=6m/s. The distance between the two drive wheels M and N is L1=10m. An object with mass m=3kg is gently placed on the conveyor belt directly above wheel M. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the object and the conveyor belt is μ=0.3.
The frictional force f is given by f = μmg = 0.3 × 3 × 10 = 9N.
The acceleration a of the object is given by a = f/m = 9/3 = 3m/s².
The time t taken for the object to reach the speed of the conveyor belt is t = v/a = 6/3 = 2s.
The distance x traveled by the object during acceleration is x = 1/2 at² = 1/2 × 3 × 2² = 6m.
The remaining distance L2 after the object reaches the speed of the conveyor belt is L2 = L1 - x = 10 - 6 = 4m.
The work done by the frictional force W is given by W = f × x = 9 × 6 = 54J.

premise: Based on the given steps and calculations
conclusion: The work done by the frictional force of the conveyor belt on the object as it is transported from point M to point N is 54J.
